answers.answer: I am also pregnant with twins di, and have polyhydramnios,  my dr just plans on monitoring my water, growth and movements. So far no change in fluids. I had the one hour glucose and failed, then passed the three hours test. I will now have weekly monitoring ultrasounds until baby arrives. I am 29 weeks now. So I pray all goes well with you and pray to deliver two healthy babies.

Don't worry too much. I've had polyhydramnios with three pregnancies and all those babies were healthy. The worst thing was getting so large and developing an umbilical hernia. Take care of yourself, get tested for GD, but don't worry too much bc sometimes it just happens.

Don't worry too much. I've had polyhydramnios with three pregnancies and all those babies were healthy. The worst thing was getting so large and developing an umbilical hernia. Take care of yourself, get tested for GD, but don't worry too much bc sometimes it just happens.
Thank you ladies! You made me feel better and just realize I can just pray for all to go well.

question: Hey ladies... I've been nervous all day and can't sleep because I had an appt with my specialist today, which I'm seeing due to the fact that I'm carrying twins and have had a miscarriage before, and when they did my ultrasound they found excess amniotic fluids in one of my baby's sac. Dr told me to not worry it could be that I have developed gestational diabetes although I just got checked 3 weeks ago and it came back normal. I googled polyhydramnios (excess fluid) and read how my baby could have swallowing issues or heart problems. Has anyone experienced this before? How was your lo? Oh and I'm 25 weeks and am going to be getting another glucose test done tomorrow as well as get seen every 2 weeks to monitor the babies.
title: scared...excess amniotic fluid in one of my fraternal boys.
